body:
I brought up a fresh k8s environment under vagrant, and once the k8s nodes were up, I started rook.  Though the k8s nodes were up, the k8s pods were still starting and were in the ContainerCreating state, and the starting up of mon1 was also in ContainerCreating state:

```
kubectl get pods --all-namespaces
NAMESPACE     NAME                                    READY     STATUS              RESTARTS   AGE
kube-system   heapster-v1.2.0-4088228293-cjdq9        0/2       ContainerCreating   0          37s
kube-system   kube-apiserver-172.17.4.101             1/1       Running             0          3m
kube-system   kube-controller-manager-172.17.4.101    1/1       Running             0          3m
kube-system   kube-dns-782804071-pb42h                4/4       Running             0          3m
kube-system   kube-dns-autoscaler-2715466192-lq1n4    1/1       Running             0          3m
kube-system   kube-proxy-172.17.4.101                 1/1       Running             0          3m
kube-system   kube-proxy-172.17.4.201                 1/1       Running             0          2m
kube-system   kube-proxy-172.17.4.202                 0/1       ContainerCreating   0          1m
kube-system   kube-proxy-172.17.4.203                 0/1       ContainerCreating   0          1m
kube-system   kube-scheduler-172.17.4.101             1/1       Running             0          1m
kube-system   kubernetes-dashboard-3543765157-hpc0s   1/1       Running             0          3m
rook          mon0                                    1/1       Running             0          1m
rook          mon1                                    0/1       ContainerCreating   0          1m
rook          rook-operator-35208636-ngkw3            1/1       Running             0          3m
```

The rook-operator timed out waiting for mon1:
```
kubectl logs rook-operator-35208636-ngkw3 | tail -5
2017-04-07 16:05:21.426712 I | op-mon: waiting 6s for pod mon1 to start. status=Pending
2017-04-07 16:05:27.432273 I | op-mon: waiting 6s for pod mon1 to start. status=Pending
2017-04-07 16:05:33.449931 I | op-mon: waiting 6s for pod mon1 to start. status=Pending
2017-04-07 16:05:39.456016 I | op-mon: waiting 6s for pod mon1 to start. status=Pending
2017-04-07 16:05:45.462480 E | operator: failed to create cluster in namespace rook. failed to start the mons. failed to start mon pods. failed to start pod mon1. timed out waiting for pod mon1 to start
```
and didn't recover, even when mon1 eventually started running, here's after almost a half an hour:
```
kubectl get pods --namespace=rook
NAME                           READY     STATUS    RESTARTS   AGE
mon0                           1/1       Running   0          28m
mon1                           1/1       Running   0          28m
rook-operator-35208636-ngkw3   1/1       Running   0          30m
```
title: rook operator doesn't recover it if times out waiting for mons to start
